subclassFeature.name: The Watcher
entries: A {@creature beholder} is an aberration of terrible might, possessing chaotic and destructive powers, rivaled only by a few horrible creatures. Their hatred of all other beings, especially other {@creature beholder|MM|beholders}, is legendary. There are, however, documented cases of {@creature beholder|MM|beholders} empowering a minion to do their bidding, typically, to assassinate a rival {@creature beholder} or to commit some atrocity in the beholder's name. In addition to manifesting {@creature beholder}-like powers, the personality of a beholder's warlock might also warp to become more like that of their patron, making them more xenophobic, covetous, and utterly hateful.

entries.subclassFeature: Rays of the Eldritch Eye|Warlock|PHB|The Watcher|MFOV:TW|1

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Watcher lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Watcher Expanded Spell List
rows: 1st
{@spell magic missile}, {@spell sleep}
2nd
{@spell blindness/deafness}, {@spell see invisibility}
3rd
{@spell hypnotic pattern}, {@spell slow}
4th
{@spell arcane eye}, {@spell locate creature}
5th
{@spell legend lore}, {@spell telekinesis}

subclassFeature.name: Rays of the Eldritch Eye
entries: Starting at 1st level, your {@spell eldritch blast} is warped by your patron. When you cast your {@spell eldritch blast} cantrip, you add an additional effect to the spell, determined by the number that you rolled on the damage die. You can only apply one effect to each creature you hit with {@spell eldritch blast}. If you hit a creature with multiple beams of your {@spell eldritch blast} or roll a critical hit with one, you can choose which {@dice d10|d10's} damage value you use for the effect applied to your target.

entries.caption: Rays of the Eldritch Eye
rows: {@b Charm Ray.} The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the beginning of your next turn.
{@b Paralyzing Ray.} The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws until the beginning of your next turn.
{@b Fear Ray.} The first attack the creature makes on its next turn has disadvantage.
{@b Slow Ray.} The creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the beginning of your next turn.
{@b Enervation Ray.} The creature can't regain hit points until the beginning of your next turn.
{@b Telekinetic Ray.} The creature is pushed 10 feet away from you or pulled 10 feet closer.
{@b Sleep Ray.} The creature becomes drowsy and sluggish. On their next turn, they can take an action or a bonus action, but not both.
{@b Petrification Ray.} The creature cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn.
{@b Disintegration Ray.} One nonmagical object that the creature is carrying is destroyed.
{@b Death Ray.} The target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Paranoia of the Eyes
entries: Starting at 6th level, you constantly perceive enemies in all directions, just as your patron does. If you are surprised at the beginning of combat and aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can act normally on your first turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Additionally, your patron has granted you a potent weapon to slay its rivals: your {@spell eldritch blast} is unaffected by areas of antimagic generated by the {@spell antimagic field} spell, or a monster's ability such as a {@creature beholder|MM|beholder's} antimagic cone.

subclassFeature.name: Gaze of the Eldritch Eye
entries: Starting at 10th level, your patron's dreadful stare suffuses all the spells that you cast. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that requires a spell attack roll, roll a {@dice d10}. If you hit with your spell attack, apply the effect on the Rays of the Eldritch Eye table that corresponds to the result of your {@dice d10} roll to the target.

In addition, you gain one spell of 1st-level or higher from any spell list that requires a spell attack roll, such as {@spell ray of sickness} or {@spell scorching ray}. This spell counts as a warlock spell for you, and does not count against your warlock spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Antimagic Aura
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use an action to ward yourself against the magic of other spellcasters. You create an {@spell antimagic field} (as per the spell) with a 15-foot radius, centered on yourself. This {@spell antimagic field} moves with you. Spells cast through your Pact Magic or warlock class features, as well as objects created by your warlock class features, are not affected by this {@spell antimagic field}. This {@spell antimagic field} persists for 1 minute and does not require your {@condition concentration}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Wrath of the Eldritch Eye
entries: You can cast the spell {@spell disintegrate} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't cast the spell again in this way until you finish a long rest.
